issues.description: The problem statement and UML diagram specify a method named `calculateTotalPrice(Meal): int`, but both the template’s `Main.java` and the solution’s `SealSaloon.java` define and call a static method named `computeMealCost(Meal): int`. This name mismatch will confuse students and cause compilation failures when following the problem instructions.
issues.suggested_fix: Either rename the method in the template and solution from `computeMealCost` to `calculateTotalPrice` (and update all calls accordingly), or update the problem statement and UML to refer to `computeMealCost(Meal): int` to align names across all artifacts.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method called calculateTotalPrice(Meal):int, whereas both the template Main.java and the solution SealSaloon.java implement and invoke a method named computeMealCost(Meal):int for the same functionality. Students following the problem description will search for calculateTotalPrice but find computeMealCost in code, causing confusion and compilation errors.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. For example, rename computeMealCost to calculateTotalPrice in both template and solution code (and update Main.java accordingly), or update the problem statement to refer to computeMealCost instead of calculateTotalPrice.
